titleStmt.title: To his much honored friend Mr. Iames Haward, upon his, Translation of Donzella Desterrada out of Italian.
titleStmt.author: Br., Wi.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To his much honored friend Mr. Iames Haward, upon his, Translation of Donzella Desterrada out of Italian.
analytic.author: Br., Wi.

monogr.title: Donzella desterrada. Or, The banish'd virgin. VVritten originally in Italian: by Cavalier Gio. Francesco Biondi, Gentleman Extraordinary of his Majesties Privy Chamber. Divided into three bookes: and Englished by I.H. of Graies Inne, Gent
monogr.author: Biondi, Giovanni Francesco, Sir

div.head: To his much honored friend Mr. Iames Haward, upon his, Translation of Donzella Desterrada out of Italian.

lg.l: LEt none mistake my purpose, some will ghesse,
I have committed these few lines to th' Presse
To honour thee (deare friend) in commendation
Of thy so learned, so well penn'd Translation:
But they erre much: my duller Muse ne're durst
Aspire so high; since who'le commend, must first
Assume a power to judge; or else declare
His praise (since groundlesse) vaine as th' idle aire.
But this is not my aime; I but desire
T' expresse my service, that when all admire
(As needes they must) thy worth; and justest fame
Shall lowd resound the Banish't Virgins name,
And thee her Tutor, I may humbly then,
Waite on the triumph of thy matchlesse penne.
Haward, el gran valor, y hermosura
De la Donzella Desterrada serive,
Con gentileza tanta, y dulcura,
Que mas ser Destierrada no parece:
Pues aqùi es por ella fabricada
Vna etèrna y muy bel'morada.

closer.signed: Wi. Br. ex hospitio Graiensi Gen.
